This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=BLE-ACCESSIBILITY.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2014-06-30T10:22:19Z Carol John 2014-06-30T12:12:13+01:00 2014-06-30T12:12:13+01:00 Re: Sad news https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLE-ACCESSIBILITY;d8785f4d.1406 I'm sure there will be far more many people than space in the service but I<br>just want to come and pay my respects to Debs, even if I'm standing outside.<br><br>Carol<br><br>(SOAS)<br><br>On 30 June 2014 11:55, Carolyn Hunt <C.Hunt@ioe.ac.uk> wrote:<br><br>> Dear all,<br>><br>><br>><br>> I am in contact with Deb's sister and she has said that there are very<br>> limited numbers at the crematorium. Further details are....<br>><br>><br>><br>> Friday 4 July at 13.45<br>><br>> Portchester Crematorium, South Chapel (between Fareham and Portsmouth in<br>> Hampshire)<br>><br>> There will be [...] Carolyn Hunt 2014-06-30T11:55:35+01:00 2014-06-30T11:55:35+01:00 Re: Sad news https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLE-ACCESSIBILITY;86aec635.1406 Dear all,<br><br>I am in contact with Deb's sister and she has said that there are very limited numbers at the crematorium. Further details are....<br><br>Friday 4 July at 13.45<br>Portchester Crematorium, South Chapel (between Fareham and Portsmouth in Hampshire)<br>There will be a reception after the memorial service at the Cams Mill pub close by on the A27. The pub is new and has good access for wheelchairs and a good quality disabled toilet.<br>You may like to know, and pass the word, that the family has set up a just giving page, so that people who knew Deb [...] Sherman, Sarah 2014-06-30T10:52:53+00:00 2014-06-30T10:52:53+00:00 Sad news https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLE-ACCESSIBILITY;3e554296.1406 Dear All,<br><br>It was brought to my attention last week that Deb Viney, SOAS' Diversity Adviser, recently and suddenly passed away. Unfortunately, I do not have any further details but that her memorial service taking place on 4 Jul at 1.45pm at Portchester Crematorium in Hampshire.<br><br>With kind regards,<br>Sarah Sherman, Sarah 2014-06-02T11:25:11+00:00 2014-06-02T11:25:11+00:00 FW: News release: Disabled learners celebrate changes to copyright law https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLE-ACCESSIBILITY;66d5d852.1406 FYI<br><br>Jisc Press Release<br><br>Having problems viewing this email? See our online<http://jisc.msgfocus.com/q/15Q2BtNbdQg8nhZUIr/wv> version.<br><br>[http://jisc.msgfocus.com/files/amf_jisc/project_1/Headers/header_shadow.jpg]<br><br>News release<br>02 June 2014<br><br>Disabled learners celebrate changes to copyright law<br><br>Today Jisc welcomed reforms to copyright law<http://jisc.msgfocus.com/c/18G3HxZ2J2KFzksZtQ7P> that expand the ability of \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdauthorised bodies\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd, including colleges and universities, to copy work and make it more accessible for disabled people. It does this by removing previous legal restrictions on what can be copied and by whom. [...] Sherman, Sarah 2014-05-22T15:31:43+00:00 2014-05-22T15:31:43+00:00 Bloomsbury Accessibility Forum: Follow-up https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLE-ACCESSIBILITY;c7acf052.1405 Dear All,<br><br>It was great to see so many people at the meeting on Tuesday. Many thanks to our presenters, Penny, Denise, Barbara and Linda and to all those that came along and contributed and to VerseOne for sponsoring the refreshments.<br><br>To continue the discussions, to access the transcript from the first part of the meeting and to review the PowerPoint presentations, a Moodle course has been set up specifically for this group. To enrol, follow these steps: [...] Sherman, Sarah 2014-04-10T12:30:25+00:00 2014-04-10T12:30:25+00:00 Bloomsbury Accessibility Forum, Tues 20th May 2014, 2 \ufffd\ufffd 4.30pm https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLE-ACCESSIBILITY;35f95116.1404 *Please forward to colleagues in your College who may be interested*<br>[cid:554D1D41-8FF8-41FC-9D5B-AE71D4E354BB]<br>Bloomsbury Accessibility Forum<br>Tuesday 20th May 2014, 1.30 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 4.30pm<br>LIDC, 36 Gordon Square<br><br>Please book here<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1bcUntpOjbpuvFuF-OMmQd6GobtuhB-rnGqKVEDe1aes/viewform><br><br>How is your institution harnessing the best out of technology to support students with specific needs? What more could or should your institution be providing? Are you stuck for ideas \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd or are you bursting with useful tips and advice that you could share with like-minded colleagues? The Bloomsbury Accessibility Forum will present the opportunity for you to talk to colleagues across the Bloomsbury Colleges about common issues, particularly those related [...]
